archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Picanha Jerk Fajitas with Avocado and Lime
description: Thin-sliced picanha steak is tossed in a ghost pepper–jerk style seasoning, seared hot with peppers and onions, and stuffed into warm tortillas with avocado and lime. Fiery, fast, and family-friendly to assemble.
prep_steps: Thinly slice picanha steak against the grain.
Slice bell peppers and onion into thin strips.
Finely chop spring onion and garlic.
Halve the lime; cut extra wedges if desired.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, lime juice, vinegar, allspice, oregano, salt, black pepper, habanero sauce, and a pinch of brown sugar.
Toss sliced steak with the marinade; set aside 5 minutes.
Slice avocado just before cooking to avoid browning.
If using OutdoorGrill, preheat to high; otherwise preheat a large stovetop skillet on high.
cook_steps: OutdoorGrill option: Place a grill pan or basket on the grill. Grill peppers and onion 3–4 minutes until charred-tender; remove.
StoveTop option: Add a little olive oil to the hot skillet; stir-fry peppers and onion 3–4 minutes until charred-tender; remove.
Add a touch of olive oil. Sear marinated steak in a single layer 1–2 minutes per side until just cooked and slightly charred.

Return peppers and onion to the pan with the steak; add garlic and spring onion; toss 30–60 seconds. Adjust heat with extra habanero sauce or a pinch of chilli flakes if desired. Check seasoning with salt and black pepper.
Warm tortillas briefly on the grill or directly over a burner/skillet until pliable.
Assemble fajitas: fill tortillas with steak-pepper mix, top with avocado, and squeeze lime over the top. Serve immediately.
